description: From Greenlandic pingu or Inuktitut pingu (“hummock, small hill”).

entries.meaning: (geomorphology) A conical mound of earth with an ice core caused by permafrost uplift, particularly if lasting more than a year. [from 1920s]

description: Apparently from Sinhalese [Term?] (?), but the word has not yet been identified.

entries.meaning: (Sri Lanka, dated) A flexible pole supported on one shoulder, with a load suspended from each end.
examples: Synonyms: carrying pole, milkmaid's yoke, shoulder pole

entries.meaning: (Sri Lanka, dated) A measure of weight equivalent to that which can be carried using a pingo, perhaps about 55 pounds (25 kilograms) (see the 2013 quotation).
